title: Let zephyr stack with Merc Treads
body:
Dear Riot,

I hate getting CC'd. Lets just let it all stack and nerf nunu. That or make me a bruiser that has a 30% CC reduction passive such that I can build him to around 500 MS.

Sincerely,
MightySaturn

replies.body:
You are all wrong. 

Frozen mallet on the adc would deal with this. It applies a single target slow of 35% on hit. So if you are being auto'd 2x per second, you are perma slowed unless you have 100% tenacity. In my opinion, this would actually make frozen mallet a viable, interesting buy. 

I am still interested in a bruiser/tank with passive reduction.

Frozen Mallet slow lasts 1.5 seconds.

78.5% CC reduction means that it lasts 0.323 seconds.

Still can't keep up with/escape an Ireila. Equilibrium Strike and Bladesurge exist.
Its called balancing. Reduce stats then let it stack. So early game cc is more effective, late game cc less effective. So i dont get stun locked late game in a team fight. I HATE THAT.

The only way to make Tenacity stacking balanced would be to nerf current Tenacity values so that the stacking doesn't end up much higher than it can already go. Which would be difficult and convoluted, considering that the few stacking sources already stack multiplicatively.

*If you didn't get that, then get this: Tenacity is balanced as it is, and it's strong enough.*

If you want to avoid getting stun-locked in a team fight, you have options. Irelia and Mundo both have innate Tenacity. Olaf, Alistar and Gangplank have innate CC removal. Poppy's ultimate ignores any CC or damage that doesn't come from her main target. Or you can just play smart, because outplaying their CC is easier than learning how to play 6 specific champs.

UH. Thats convoluted? Difficult? Wow. You get dressed in the morning? You lower tenacity from zephyr and merc treads at the same time. Thats one step mate.

Still too complicated? Sure...how bout a cap on tenacity? Thats really simple. 60% Max tenacity. Cooldown reduction already has the same thing. Set the cap at 60% if you want. Set it to where 2 autos/sec from frozen mallet gives a constant slow. Whatever. Just make it easier for me to get to. I like zephyr. I like Phage. I hate cc. Not fond of Irelia. Mundo is cheesy. Gangplank is a joke.

You are weirdly short sighted. "Reduce Tenacity values? What? Thats so hard!"

????

You are rather simple-minded.

1) Tenacity is *already balanced around the way it is designed*. Changing the system is over-complicating things, because that means you have to rebalance Tenacity, and possibly rebalance CC around the rebalanced Tenacity if things aren't as they are now. The only reason you don't see it as complicated is probably a lack of understanding mechanics.

2) Comparing Tenacity to CDR is like comparing Health to Mana Regen. Entirely unrelated stats with entirely different purposes, have rarely been on the same item at the same time, and don't have any scaling relevant to each other. *And why not just view the 35% Tenacity as a cap on item tenacity?*

3) I did not say that reducing Tenacity would be hard. I said that it would be difficult and convoluted to find the right numbers for a stack-able Tenacity stat, because it already scales multiplicatively with the few sources that do stack. **The math behind it is more complex than you think, in very small words so you understand what I mean.** 25% Tenacity plus 25% Tenacity does not equal 50%, it equals 43.75%, because multiplicative scaling.

Considering that there's a jungler enchantment for Tenacity, we'd have to balance 3 Tenacity items to give a total of 35-40% Tenacity when stacked together, because players would want to stack it. That means these three items would grant 13.35% to 15.5% Tenacity apiece.

"No they wouldn't--"

Yes, they would. **Because Tenacity is already balanced around being 35% from items.** They would need to rebalance the system if passive CC resistance from items could go above that.

4) Not really. Why bother to get dressed? Clothes are so damn weird.

"I did not say that reducing Tenacity would be hard. I said that it would be difficult"

Im sorry. What?
Are you incapable of reading an entire thought before taking things out of context, you fucking troll?

Yes I am. 

Please try and explain to me the subtle difference between saying something is hard vs. saying something would be difficult and convoluted. I am also capable of talking on the internet without using the f'word.

It looks like you dont actually think things through. It looks like you are just the type of person who regurgitates the things you have read from other people. For instance, calling me a troll when I am sincere.   I want to make frozen mallet a viable item by making stacking tenacity more effective. I want a class of supports who have true cc which ignores tenacity. Thats what could set a support apart from an off support. In case you hadnt noticed, most supports can solo lane. I.E. Morgana, Zilean.

>

> Please try and explain to me the subtle difference between saying something is hard vs. saying something would be difficult and convoluted.

I did not say that changing the numbers would be hard to do.

I said it would be difficult and convoluted--finding the right numbers would be more trouble than it's worth--*due to the way the system works right now*. Because of how Tenacity is currently scaled, designed and balanced, making this one change would require either a lot of number-juggling to find the right balance, or it would require rehauling the system. It's difficult to find the exact balance point for stackable Tenacity, and convoluted, considering the system already works.

The actual change of the numbers is not what's difficult. Calculating how those changes affect balance, and figuring out the perfect numbers to use, *that's* difficult and convoluted for the purpose of this change.
> I am also capable of talking on the internet without using the f'word.

Because it's *so* much more mature to play the idiot than it is to swear. Please, o paragon of maturity, perhaps you can teach us the best way to argue on the internet without looking like a massive prick--wait, you fucked that one up.

1) No, I just don't bother to explain the exact context of what I'm saying. I don't want to waste time and writing on a person who's not going to read a wall of text explaining exactly what I mean. I mean, look at you; you couldn't read the whole sentence before stopping at the word "Difficult" because difficult and hard are synonymous. How can I trust you with a wall explaining exactly what I mean if you shut down that fast?

2) Frozen Mallet has its niche. It doesn't need to be more widespread, which is most likely why Riot removed Phage from its build path. And making Tenacity stack is not going to make Frozen Mallet any more important than it is now.

3) This change doesn't get anything that you wanted, except for champions capable of ignoring CC that isn't Airborne or Suppression. But everyone who actually knows what that would imply *doesn't want it*. CC-proof Irelia is terrifying enough. Giving that to Shyvana, Jarvan, Vi, Xin Zhao, Malphite, Trundle and pretty much every single bruiser on the roster is going to bring back the League of Bruisers, which nobody--nobody who went through that and wasn't a bruiser main--wants to happen.

Balancing tenacity is rolled up into reducing tenacity. Set it to where 2 autos/sec from frozen mallet gives a constant slow. Thats pretty simple. Its also probably around 50%-60% tenacity. Which btw is ALREADY achievable through the various items and elixers. I just want to build zephyr and merc treads. I like high MS! I hate CC! I am a bruiser main! I like Darius. He is overpowered, but i like him cause he jets around with phage and his MS passive! I also liked Hecarim before I figured our he was WAAAY to weak early game.

You are the one puttin on airs because you think tenacity multiplicative stacking is soooo complicated but you understand it. Wow. I have a degree in physics. You dont see me bringing that up to shame people do you? No. I am just saying it in my own defense.

Also, it SOUNDS like a CC cap at 60% would make irrelia LESS effective!!!! BC her TEnacity is above that with her passive. I havnt done the math ok? I just want to run around with my merc boots and my zephyr fast as fuck. Get off my back you weirdo.

You said you werent saying it would be hard. You said it would be difficult and convoluted. I asked you what the difference was.

I just think you are wrong. Get over it. You get mad whenever anyone disagree's? GL with that. I only get mad when people curse to me and that doesnt really happen irl. Because its not polite and you would get fired for it.

Maybe it's because I know the proper context for swearing, or the fact that every single one of my bosses occasionally swore. Warehouses, construction, programming, game industry, fast food, retail...as long as you know when it's acceptable, nobody gives a damn.

And, again, I'm not mad. Frustrated, sure; you're trying to play the victim with your horrible idea. But if I was actually angry, I probably wouldn't be on the forums.

I am just saying that I like bruisers bc of the styling (kind of manly) and** I'd like to be able to hit and run like the ranged casters do. ** Thats one of the reasons I like tanky tenacious darius. He has hella high MS. Also hecarim is cool at times. Just too weak. You dont seem to think that would be fair. WHY? Ezreal just kites all day. Thats like hit and run. Can you please reboot and just explain. Without becoming deliberately insulting? Feel free to disagree politely.

Im sorry, do you like getting stun locked in a team fight? So Katerana can ult you down when there is nothing you can do ab it?

I dont think of Jayce as the type of bruiser I want. He has a projectile doesnt he? Thats why he is hit and run. He is a bruser/ranged champ isnt he? Maybe I didnt ask you to help me find one? Cause Ive played against every champ in the league and there isnt a melee champ that can deal with a team that wants to stun lock you. Except I guess Irelia. Ive never laned against her. Strange, but true.

Jayce is hit and run because he is ranged....that is my evaluation. Melee hit and run is what I would like. I.E. Hecarim if he was done the way i think he should be.

The problem with melee champions is the level of commitment that is required if you want to do some damage. High MS mitigates this, but if i have to worry about stun after stun then there's nothing I can do until my entire team commits and the enemy is distracted with several targets who can cover for me. Or so I think.

Now, heres another idea. What if you put an enchant on a melee only item that reduces the effectiveness of subsequent stuns. So its like tenacity that builds as you are stun locked for longer. It basically puts a cap on the duration of obnoxious stuns. I would b ok with that. 

I dont want to be immune to stuns like irrelia. I dont really want to be op like darius. Id really like to be a hecarim that straifs the enemy causing surprise and disruption (Not necessarily deaths!) then returns to the jungle. I feel like that is entirely reasonable and obtainable without breaking the system. There just needs to be an idea. 

How does the reduced returns on repetitive stuns sound to you? Its not really tenacity as it stands. And it might be easier to balance,

You want to play a bruiser that has a hit-and-run playstyle, so your first step in logic is that you *must* be able to stack Tenacity for that to work.

Not, say, playing as Jayce or Lee Sin, the two best bruisers for hit-and-run, bruiser playstyle. They both have kits that allow them to either go all in, or just jump in and out.

You *could* have come with a thread asking for such a playstyle, and it wouldn't have started with people pointing out that stackable Tenacity would be broken because, unlike DotA, most CC lasts 2 seconds instead of 5. Asking people for advice is significantly less likely to get ridiculed than suggesting a change that would require rebalancing of the entire system.

Ezreal kites all day because he's Ezreal. His design is to skirt the edge of combat, going all-in or firing shots as he escapes, per the situation. If you want to be Ezreal, be Ezreal. If you want to be a bruiser that goes in and out of combat, ask which bruisers are good at that (Vi, Shyvana, Wukong, Lee Sin, Jarvan, Jayce...).

Actually, Jayce is probably exactly what you want, if Lee Sin isn't. Switching to a champion that fits the playstyle you want is a lot simpler than suggesting systemic changes that would imbalance a lot of champions for the sake of letting Darius, of all champions, ignore CC a little better than Tenacity already allows.

Come on, it'd only be like 88% tenacity max.

Passive + Zephyr + Mercs + Tenacious Mastery
40% + 35% + 35% + 15%

40%, then 35% of 60 = +21%, then 35% of 39 = +13.65%, then 15% of 25.35 = +3.8025%
for a grand total of 78.4525% Tenacity. Because the system rounds to thousandths, 78.453%
